paragraphs: This is a Beta version of experimental open source software released as a test version under an MIT license and may contain errors and/or bugs. No guarantee or representation whatsoever is made regarding its suitability (or its use) for any purpose or regarding its compliance with any applicable laws and regulations. Use of the software is at your own risk and discretion and by using the software you warrant and represent that you have read this disclaimer, understand its contents, assume all risk related thereto and hereby release, waive, discharge and covenant not to hold liable Brainbot Labs Establishment or any of its officers, employees or affiliates from and for any direct or indirect damage resulting from the the software or the use thereof. Such to the extent as permissible by applicable laws and regulations.

Privacy warning: Please be aware, that by using the Raiden Client, among others your Ethereum address, channels, channel deposits, settlements and the Ethereum address of your channel counterparty will be stored on the Ethereum chain, i.e. on servers of Ethereum node operators and ergo are to a certain extent publicly available. The same might also be stored on systems of parties running Raiden nodes connected to the same token network. Data present in the Ethereum chain is very unlikely to be able to be changed, removed or deleted from the public arena.

Also be aware, that data on individual Raiden token transfers will be made available via the Matrix protocol to the recipient, intermediating nodes of a specific transfer as well as to the Matrix server operators, see Raiden Transport Specification.
disclaimer.accept-checkbox: I have read, understood and hereby accept the above disclaimer and privacy warning
disclaimer.persist-checkbox: Don't display this message on start up

transfer.body: Enter a recipient address and a token amount to make a transfer. You need to have an open channel with the recipient or with a hub that is connected to the recipient.

transfer-steps.body: A direct transfer will be possible if you have an open channel with the recipient. In any other case, the PFS will try to find the best way to route your transfer to the recipient.

select-hub.body: A Hub is a well-connected node. You can connect to a hub or to any other node. Make sure you have enough service tokens to pay for the monitoring and pathfinding service as well as a balance of your selected token.

open-channel.body: Opening a channel will connect you to your selected hub or node. You need to choose an amount to deposit in the channel. Later you can transfer small amounts of this deposit to any recipient in the network.

channels.body: This is an overview of all your open channels for the selected token. You can choose to close and settle any channel to withdraw your tokens.

account-backup.body: Your state is stored in the browser. You should continuously keep a backup of your state by downloading the latest JSON file and storing it somewhere safe.

account-raiden.body: You need ETH on your Raiden Account to withdraw your tokens. You can add ETH by transferring it from your main account.

account-withdrawal.body: Withdraw tokens from your Raiden account back to your main account.

account-udc.body: Your User Deposit Contract stores the utility tokens necessary for paying the Pathfinding and Monitoring Service.

home.disclaimer: The Raiden dApp is a reference implementation of the Raiden Light Client SDK. It is work in progress and can only be used on Ethereum testnets.

getting-started.description: Read the {0} for detailed information on how to use the Raiden dApp.

connect-dialog.title: Connect
connect-dialog.description-raiden-account: A Raiden Account will be generated.
connect-dialog.description-web3-account: You can use your Web3 account directly by enabling it in the settings menu.
connect-dialog.no-provider: No Web3 provider detected, please install e.g. MetaMask.

notifications.tx-reorged-failure-reason: The transaction could not get confirmed due to a reorg of the blockchain!

backup-state.title: Backup your state!
backup-state.description: Backup your state to not risk losing funds
backup-state.link: Click here to go to the backup state menu

ms-balance-proof.title: Balance proof submitted
ms-balance-proof.description: A monitoring service successfully submitted a balance proof for a channel claiming a reward of {reward} {symbol}. Service: {monitoringService}, Partner: {partner}, Transaction: {txHash}

success.title: User Deposit Withdraw Planned
success.description: A planned withdrawal of {amount} {symbol} was successfully completed withdrawing {withdrawal} {symbol}

descriptions.UDC_WITHDRAW_NO_BALANCE: We could not complete the withdrawal of {amount} {symbol} because there was not enough balance.
descriptions.UDC_WITHDRAW_FAILED: We could not complete the withdrawal of {amount} {symbol} because the transaction failed.

withdrawn.title: User Deposit Tokens Withdrawn
withdrawn.description: {withdrawnAmount} {symbol} ({plannedAmount} planned) have been withdrawn from the user deposit contract.
withdrawn.link: Click here to transfer them to your main acccount.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Change how you interact with the dApp

raiden-account.title: Transfer ETH
raiden-account.subtitle: Transfer ETH between main and Raiden account

withdrawal.title: Withdraw Tokens
withdrawal.subtitle: Transfer tokens from your Raiden account to your main account

udc.title: Manage UDC Tokens
udc.subtitle: Transfer tokens from or to your User Deposit Contract

withdrawal.title: Transfer tokens to your main Ethereum account.
withdrawal.navigation-link-title: For service tokens, make sure you withdrew them at the UDC screen first.

dialog.title: Withdraw {0}
dialog.body: You are about to withdraw {0} from your Raiden account.
dialog.no-eth: Your Raiden account does not have sufficient ETH to withdraw.

withdrawal.no-tokens: The Raiden account has no tokens

udc.balance-too-low: Balance is too low for services. Deposit at least {minAmount} {tokenSymbol} to enable receiving.
udc.withdrawal-planned: The withdrawal from the user deposit has been planned. You will get notified when the withdrawal is complete.

backup-state.description: The state holds all account information except the private key. You can backup your state to make sure the dApp is kept in sync when switching between browsers.
backup-state.disabled-download: Downloading the state is only possible when connected to the dApp
backup-state.disabled-upload: Uploading the state is only possible when the dApp is disconnected
backup-state.download-warning: Downloading the state will force the dApp to shut down
backup-state.upload-error: Only one state file in valid JSON format can be uploaded

raiden-account.transfer-from-main-account: Transfer ETH from Main Account to Raiden Account
raiden-account.transfer-from-raiden-account: Transfer ETH from Raiden Account to Main Account

error.invalid-address: Enter a valid address or ENS name
error.no-checksum: Please enter an address in checksum format. You can convert your address on https://ethsum.netlify.com
error.empty: Enter an address or ENS name
error.ens-resolve-failed: Please enter a resolvable ENS name
error.invalid-excluded-address: Please enter a different address or ENS name. You can't use your own address or the address of the token network.
error.channel-not-open: Please enter a hub address you have an open channel with.

error.too-many-decimals: Please use only up to {decimals} decimals for this token
error.zero: Enter an amount larger than zero

dialog.label: Withdraw
dialog.title: Withdrawing Tokens
dialog.description: Sign the transaction in MetaMask and close this dialogue to continue using the dApp.

done.label: Done
done.title: Withdraw Successful
done.description: Your tokens have been successfully withdrawn.

find-routes.sub-title: Route(s) provided by {subdomain} including number of hops and estimated fee

open.title: Open
open.description:
You can deposit more tokens 
 or close the channel.

closed.title: Closed
closed.description:
Please wait until your channel is settleable. 
this may take some time.

settleable.title: Settleable
settleable.description:
Settle your channel to transfer 
 your tokens back to your account.

close_dialog.title: Close Channel
close_dialog.description: Are you sure you want to close this channel? This action cannot be undone.

settle_dialog.title: Settle Channel
settle_dialog.description: Are you sure you want to settle the channel with hub {partner} for token {token}?

no-access.unsupported-network: The current network is unsupported. Please choose a different network.
no-access.sdk-initialization-failure: SDK initialization failed. Please check the console for more information.
no-access.rdn-state-migration: Cannot replace state with older uploaded state.
no-access.generic-error: A valid account could not be detected. Please make sure that your provider is unlocked and accessible.

disconnect-dialog.confirmation-message: This action will close all channels for the {symbol} token! {address}

leave-done.label: Done
leave-done.title: Disconnected from the token network
leave-done.description: All your channels were successfully closed

udc-deposit-dialog.title: Deposit to UDC
udc-deposit-dialog.error: The mint and deposit operation failed.

transfer.receiving-transfer-snackbar: Receiving transfer, do not close browser.

no-channels-dialog.title: No connected tokens and open channels

request-route.title: Request Route
request-route.tooltip: Mint and deposit {token} to the User Deposit Contract to pay for PFS requests
request-route.tooltip-main: Deposit {token} to the User Deposit Contract to pay for PFS requests
request-route.udc-description: Balance to pay the Pathfinding Service
request-route.udc-description-low-balance: Your {token} token balance is too low to pay for the Pathfinding Service. Use the button above to mint and deposit more tokens.

deposit.label: Deposit
deposit.title: Depositing Tokens
deposit.description: Sign the transaction in MetaMask and close this dialogue to continue using the dApp.

deposit-done.label: Done
deposit-done.title: Deposit Successful
deposit-done.description: Your tokens have been successfully deposited.

footnotes.direct-transfer: Route request and selection skipped, because you are performing a direct transfer.
footnotes.route-selection-skipped: Automatically skipped route selection, because there was only a single route with zero fees.

select-hub.service-token-tooltip: Mint and deposit {token} to the User Deposit Contract to pay for the Monitoring Service.
select-hub.service-token-tooltip-main: Deposit {token} to the User Deposit Contract to pay for the Monitoring Service.

error.title: Ops, something went wrong
error.deposit-failed: Could not deposit to the channel.

open.label: Open
open.title: Opening a new channel
open.description: Please do not close the browser and confirm the transaction with MetaMask.

transfer.label: Transfer
transfer.title: Transferring tokens to the network and deposit into the channel
transfer.description: Please do not close the browser and confirm two (2) transactions with MetaMask.

deposit.label: Deposit
deposit.title: Not implemented - split title above, when done
deposit.description: Not implemented - split description above, when done

done.label: Done
done.title: New Channel opened
done.description: A new channel was successfully opened. You can now start making transfers.

open-channel.confirmation: Channel opening is in progress, are you sure you want to leave?

mint-dialog.title: Mint {symbol}
mint-dialog.description: If you continue, you will get prompted by MetaMask to sign off a minting transaction. In order to mint tokens, you need test net ETH in your wallet.

RDN_GENERAL_ERROR.title: An error occurred
RDN_GENERAL_ERROR.problem: We do not know this error, sorry.
solution: Please help us and report the issue
Click on your identicon in the top right corner
Click on Report Bugs / Download logs
File a new issue on https://github.com/raiden-network/light-client
Upload logs to the issue

RDN_MINT_FAILED.title: Could not mint token
RDN_MINT_FAILED.problem: It looks like the Light Client does not support minting out-of-the-box for this token contract.
RDN_MINT_FAILED.solution: You may try to mint manually via MetaMask and Etherscan. You can find a step-by-step guide on https://github.com/raiden-network/light-client#minting-manually.

PFS_UNKNOWN_TOKEN_NETWORK.title: No open channels
PFS_UNKNOWN_TOKEN_NETWORK.problem: You don't seem to have open channels on this token network.
solution: Hit the ← button in the top left
Click on the current token network
Select Connect new token
Select the token you want to transfer
Proceed with the flow to open a new channel

PFS_INVALID_INFO.title: Couldn't understand Pathfinding Service
PFS_INVALID_INFO.problem: The Light Client has received a response from the Pathfinding Service that it couldn't understand. It's possible that the current Light Client version is out-of-sync with the Pathfinding Service.
solution: Update the dApp by reloading the page
Attempt a new transfer
If the problem persists, please help us and report the issue
Click on your identicon in the top right corner
Click on Report Bugs / Download logs
File a new issue on https://github.com/raiden-network/light-client
Upload logs to the issue

PFS_NO_ROUTES_FOUND.title: No routes found
PFS_NO_ROUTES_FOUND.problem: Pathfinding Service wasn't able to find a route in the Raiden Network to perform your transfer.
PFS_NO_ROUTES_FOUND.solution: Make sure that you either have a direct channel with the target or that both of you are connected to a well-connected hub.

PFS_ERROR_RESPONSE.title: Pathfinding replied with an error
PFS_ERROR_RESPONSE.problem: While communicating with the Pathfinding Service, you have received an error response that we don't actively handle yet.
solution: Simply retry your last action
If the problem persists, please help us and report the issue
Click on your identicon in the top right corner
Click on Report Bugs / Download logs
File a new issue on https://github.com/raiden-network/light-client
Upload logs to the issue

PFS_DISABLED.title: Pathfinding Service disabled
PFS_DISABLED.problem: You tried to find a route in the Raiden Network but Pathfinding was either disabled in your configuration or you did not select a valid Pathfinding Service.
PFS_DISABLED.solution: Try to restart the Light Client by reloading the page and attempt a new transfer.

PFS_TARGET_OFFLINE.title: Target address is offline
PFS_TARGET_OFFLINE.problem: You are trying to send tokens to an offline target.
PFS_TARGET_OFFLINE.solution: Hit the ← button and verify that the address is online or choose a different target address.

PFS_LAST_IOU_REQUEST_FAILED.title: Error while depositing tokens for Pathfinding Service
PFS_LAST_IOU_REQUEST_FAILED.problem: While trying to deposit tokens for route requests, the Pathfinding Service returned an error.
solution: This should happen very rarely, please retry to deposit
If the problem persists, please help us and report the issue
Click on your identicon in the top right corner
Click on Report Bugs / Download logs
File a new issue on https://github.com/raiden-network/light-client
Upload logs to the issue

PFS_IOU_SIGNATURE_MISMATCH.title: Error while depositing tokens for Pathfinding Service
PFS_IOU_SIGNATURE_MISMATCH.problem: While trying to deposit tokens for route requests, the Pathfinding Service encountered mismatching signatures.
solution: This should happen very rarely, please retry to deposit
If the problem persists, please help us and report the issue
Click on your identicon in the top right corner
Click on Report Bugs / Download logs
File a new issue on https://github.com/raiden-network/light-client
Upload logs to the issue

PFS_NO_ROUTES_BETWEEN_NODES.title: No route between you and your target
PFS_NO_ROUTES_BETWEEN_NODES.problem: The Pathfinding Service was not able to find a usable route between you and the target you want to transfer tokens to.
solution: Hit the ← button in the top left
Click on the current token network
Select Connect new token
Select the token you want to transfer
Connect with a more popular hub, e.g. hub.raiden.eth. That way, Pathfinding Service is more likely to find a route between you and the target
Retry your transfer

permission.title: Grant Camera Access
permission.description: In order to scan QR codes, you will need to allow camera access.

raiden-account.title: Use Raiden Account
raiden-account.description: By default the dApp uses a generated Raiden account to sign messages. Disable the Raiden account to use your Web3 provider account. All messages will then have to be signed manually.
